author: i24News
title: Waze Wants Users to Stay Away From PA Controlled Territory
text:
Israeli-built navigation application Waze has started directing its users to longer, alternate routes, which don't lead them through territory controlled by the Palestinian Authority, Israeli news site Ynet reported on Friday.
According to the report, trips are delayed by 20 minutes or more in order to ensure the safety of the drivers following the recent increase of violence in East Jerusalem and the West Bank.
One route, from The First Station in Jerusalem to the City of David in Jerusalem, which is less than one kilometer apart, takes over 30 minutes if a user follows directions given by Waze, according to Ynet.
If a user does not follow the directions, which they can if they change the settings in the application, the drive would only take 10 minutes.
Jerusalem Mayor Nir Barkat responded to the report saying that he intends to speak to the CEO of Waze to demand the company remove the setting.
"Waze's designation of areas of Jerusalem as belonging to the Palestinian Authority is factually incorrect and unacceptable. I demand the company's management to change it and not turn an app into a political tool."
Jerusalem police also responded to the report, telling Ynet that "Police are acting together with Waze for the benefit of its users and to better direct them to their destination, with an emphasis on holidays and special events during which routes are closed," stressing that "police officers are deployed throughout Jerusalem and especially in East Jerusalem in order to ensure safe travel on all of the city's routes."
Waze is a popular Israeli navigation application that was bought by Google bought in 2013 in a deal worth over $1 billion.
